key_title: Key to the species of Veronica

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Plantaginaceae

source.author: Briggs, B.G.; Barker, W.R.
source.title: Veronica
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Briggs, B.G.; Barker, W.R. (1999). Veronica. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Capsule septicidal and often partly loculicidal, usually not strongly compressed; woody perennials, subshrubs or shrubs
Capsule loculicidal and sometimes partly septicidal, strongly laterally compressed; annual or perennial herbs
Leaves broadly elliptic to obovate-oblong or oblong, coriaceous to almost fleshy, margins never with teeth, apex obtuse
Leaves pinnate, lanceolate to narrow-ovate, thin textured, margins often with teeth, apex acute or acuminate
Leaves pinnately divided, often further divided or lobed
Leaves not pinnately divided
Leaves non-glaucous, not fused at base, margins with 30–80 pairs of apiculate teeth; flowers white or pale lilac or pale blue
Leaves stongly glaucous, at least some fused at base, margins entire, finely crenate or with up to c. 10 pairs of shallow or coarse acute teeth; flowers blue or purplish-blue
Herbs growing in or near water; stems hollow, glabrous, mostly more than 30 cm high
Herbs of non-aquatic sites; stems not hollow, pilose, mostly less than 30 cm high
Flowers blue or lilac, capsule usually slightly longer than broad and not or scarcely emarginate; fruiting pedicels ascending, mostly 5–6 mm long and longer than bracts
Flowers pink, capsule usually broader than long and slightly emarginate; fruiting pedicels spreading, mostly 2.5–3 mm long and shorter than bracts
Perennial herbs, flowers in lateral racemes with bracts distinctly smaller than leaves
Annual or perennial herbs, flowers in axils of leaves or bracts on upper parts of leafy stems (i.e. in terminal racemes); bracts similar to or much smaller than leaves
Pedicels less than 5 mm long in fruit
Pedicels more than 5 mm long in fruit
Leaves ovate-triangular, coarsely toothed or crenate with obtuse teeth (but sometimes withered at anthesis); style 0.3–0.8 mm long in fruit; stems usually densely pilose

Leaves narrow- or broad-elliptic, entire or very shallowly toothed or crenate; style in fruit either less than 0.3 mm long or longer than 1.3 mm; stems mostly sparsely pilose or with minutely antrorse hairs
Leaves narrow-elliptic; style virtually obsolete (to c. 0.2 mm long); stems with scat- tered spreading glandular hairs
Leaves broad-elliptic, style 1.3–3 mm long in fruit; stems glabrous or with minute, antrorse hairs (rarely glandular-pilose)
Pedicels 30–40 mm long in fruit; capsules distinctly broader than long
Pedicels 12–18 mm long in fruit; capsules slightly broader than long
Plant with above-ground stolons or prostrate stems
Plant with underground rhizomes
Leaves mostly more than 30 mm long
Leaves mostly less than 30 mm long
Leaves with base cuneate; capsules shallowly obcordate with rounded lobes; calyx- lobes often glabrous toward apex; stem-hairs mostly long and spreading

Leaves with base mostly truncate; capsules slightly emarginate with somewhat diverging lobes; calyx-lobes usually finely ciliate on margins and apex; stem-hairs mostly short, slender and antrorsely curved
Racemes 15–25-flowered
Racemes mostly up to 10-flowered
Corolla-lobes 8–12 mm long; capsule glabrous; far south-west only
Corolla-lobes to 6 mm long; capsule ciliate or glabrous; widespread herbs
Leaves with rounded or subacute apex and teeth; hairs on stems 1–2 mm long
Leaves with acute apex and teeth; hairs on stems all or mostly less than 0.4 mm long

Stems with fine rigid hairs, (0.1–)0.2–0.5 mm long; sepals (4.5–)5.5–7(–8); leaves narrow-ovate or linear, mostly 1.5–4 mm wide, entire or with 1–4 pairs of spreading teeth; capsule longer than wide, upper margin with scattered hairs
Stems with very short hairs c. 0.1 mm long; sepals (3.5–)4–5 mm long; leaves linear, mostly 0.6–2 mm wide, entire; capsule wider than long, glabrous
